speaker: Fourth Lord
text_entry: ACT IV

speaker: Fourth Lord
text_entry: SCENE I. Without the walls of Athens.

speaker: Fourth Lord
text_entry: Enter TIMON

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: Let me look back upon thee. O thou wall,

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: That girdlest in those wolves, dive in the earth,

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: And fence not Athens! Matrons, turn incontinent!

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: Obedience fail in children! slaves and fools,

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: Pluck the grave wrinkled senate from the bench,

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: And minister in their steads! to general filths

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: Convert o' the instant, green virginity,

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: Do 't in your parents' eyes! bankrupts, hold fast;

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: Rather than render back, out with your knives,

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: And cut your trusters' throats! bound servants, steal!

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: Large-handed robbers your grave masters are,

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: And pill by law. Maid, to thy master's bed;

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: Thy mistress is o' the brothel! Son of sixteen,

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: pluck the lined crutch from thy old limping sire,

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: With it beat out his brains! Piety, and fear,

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: Religion to the gods, peace, justice, truth,

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: Domestic awe, night-rest, and neighbourhood,

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: Instruction, manners, mysteries, and trades,

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: Degrees, observances, customs, and laws,

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: Decline to your confounding contraries,

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: And let confusion live! Plagues, incident to men,

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: Your potent and infectious fevers heap

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: On Athens, ripe for stroke! Thou cold sciatica,

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: Cripple our senators, that their limbs may halt

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: As lamely as their manners. Lust and liberty

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: Creep in the minds and marrows of our youth,

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: That 'gainst the stream of virtue they may strive,

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: And drown themselves in riot! Itches, blains,

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: Sow all the Athenian bosoms; and their crop

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: Be general leprosy! Breath infect breath,

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: at their society, as their friendship, may

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: merely poison! Nothing I'll bear from thee,

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: But nakedness, thou detestable town!

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: Take thou that too, with multiplying bans!

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: Timon will to the woods; where he shall find

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: The unkindest beast more kinder than mankind.

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: The gods confound--hear me, you good gods all--

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: The Athenians both within and out that wall!

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: And grant, as Timon grows, his hate may grow

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: To the whole race of mankind, high and low! Amen.

speaker: TIMON
text_entry: Exit
